text: Excellent dîner hier: mets savoureux et frais, belle variété de plats. Nous allons y retourner sans faute. Chef et proprio agréables et disponibles. Et que dire des épices utilisées, mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
Super prix, super bon et une terasse.  Emmener votre vin.  Même la crème glacée au dessert est à volonté.  Un bon repas sorti de l'ordinaire et sans prétention.

After reading the top reviews, my husband and I had to try it out. We were very disappointed. The food is served buffet style with a fixed price. Unfortunately, the steam table had not been turned on so the food was cold. We were there at 6 p.m. and it should have been hot. The two saving graces were the spanikopida and the squash soup. The salad consisted of iceberg lettuce and croutons with a drizzle of ranch dressing. It is a byob and they serve mint water at the table. I would not recommend this place.
Super bon! Agréablement surprise, le poulet au beurre vraiment bon  hummm hum hum tout est bon, à essayer

Tristement, ce resto rempli d'ambition s'est ajusté au goût de sa clientèle et a peu à voir avec la cuisine Méditerranéenne et encore moins avec son propre nom que l'on retrouve que dans une salade froide dans un plat de 20cmX20cm...  Les amants de la cuisine sans viande seront déçus et les gourmands de grillades et viandes en sauce/ragoût à la façon du Moyen Orient seront comblés.  Les proprios sont charmants et le personnel sont charmants.  Les lieux, surtout la terrasse, sont bien aménagés.

Endroit incroyable un incontournable de la ville à ne pas manquer buffet la bouffe est fraiche, les sauces sont bien réalisé, les marinade succulente, le poulet au beurre est divin et les grillades exquises!! :)

Premiere visite il y a environ 1 1/2 mois nous avions aimé. Milieu de semaine et nous avions pris un plat pour apporter environ 12$. Tres raisonnable. Un mois plus tard nous retournons et cest maintenant plus de 20$ par plat... pour du take out cest trop cher! Le gout et la qualité est tres bien par contre.

This is probably my favorite mediteranian buffet EVER! I was just passing through the city when stubbled to this restaurant. From the butter chicken to the merguez, everything is so delicious! The staff is very friendly. The ambiance is calm. The restaurant is clean and well organized. Best part is that they offered ice cream and baklava at the end! YUM! I definitely recommend this restaurant. If you live far away from it like me, it's sooooo worth it to drive all the way there at least once to try it.

Best discovery in a long time!  I saw an ad on Facebook for this place and came all the way from Laval because of their mouthwatering photos- it is well worth the drive.   Intimate no frills restaurant that serves an array of mediterranean inspired dishes under an all you can eat formula. This is not your typical buffet! Le Pois Chiche goes above and beyond with fresh housemade concoctions, lots of salad options, grilled meats like brochettes that are prepared to order, curries, butter chicken, merguez sausages, lamb, calamari, shrimp, salmon and the juiciest tender signature "Nazareth" chicken speciality that was a favorite amongst my family. All these to be enjoyed with beloved sides: garlic potatoes and garlic sauce, naan, basmati rice, fried lebanese style rice, and grilled veggies. Coffee and dessert are included, fried banana and ice cream covered in maple syrup.  They even have a poutine bar with unlimited gravy and curd cheese!! A fun option for kids tagging along or picky eaters.   Behind the delicious feast is one man preparing it all. I was super impressed with the quality of the food and how much effort and preparation went into it. The chef prepares most of it in front of you, as the kitchen is open. I saw him peeling and cutting his own potatoes and constantly popping things on the grill. It's all from scratch.   A must try, for 12.99$ for lunch, 16.99$ for dinner and 2 for 22$ specials during the week, you won't find this kind of unlimited delicacy elsewhere.   They don't have a website but post regularly on social media. You can find videos and better pics of their selection on their Facebook page :)  Bonus: you can bring your own wine.
